text: [music playing]

BERNARDO SILVA: This season the
atmosphere in the dressing room

is amazing, also
because when you win

it's easier to have this
feeling around your teammates,

as well because we
are all very young,

and we feel like
playing together.
It's really good.
And we're enjoying a lot.

CHRISTINA MACFARLANE: Now that
you've come so far this season,

you're top of the league, you
know, the Champions League.

You're about to play
in the Quarter-Finals.

How disappointed will you be
if you don't win either or both
of those this season?

BERNARDO SILVA: Well, we know
that in this month and a half
we'll be playing everything.

We can win everything, and we
can lose everything as well.

We have the French Cup, as
well against Paris in Paris.
That is very difficult.
Then we're first in the league.

It won't be easy, but
I think we'll do it.

And then Champions League,
as everybody knows,

it's a very difficult
competition that we will
try to go as far as possible.

CHRISTINA MACFARLANE: I
mentioned that you are
much sought after this season.

Is there any particular
league that you still

want to play in in
your career that you
have ambitions to move on to?

BERNARDO SILVA: For
now, I am feeling
very, very well here in Monaco.
It's my third season in France.

But of course, all
the players, they want
to play in the best leagues--
Spain, England are the best.

And of course, I dream
one day to be there.

CHRISTINA MACFARLANE:
And what do

you think Monaco
will give you as you
move forward in your career?

What will you take
from your time here?

BERNARDO SILVA: Well, it
was my first big experience.

It is my first big
experience in a big level,

so I'll be forever
grateful to Monaco.

And it was here that I
learned most of the things
that I know about football.
